content: This app is fantastic. It not pushing subscriptions at you and allowing you to download your ride data as a FIT file for offline analysis is a breath of fresh air. Nits / Suggestions / Bugs in no particular order ... (1) I don't think I'm really burning as many kcals as the app reports. I'm but 5' 6" weighing 135 lb. (which I cannot add to my profile). (2) Let me manually START and END each ride (3) Keep TWO timers per ride ... Total Time Riding Time (Total Time - stationary time) Use Riding Time to calculate kcals and average speed. (4) My Max Speed is stated at 76.2 mph.! You would think I would remember that.:) (5) A stealth mode for the Ride Screen with a tap wake-up would be nice. I can already work around this but it requires more phone interactions. Ideally I would set the numbers of minutes for the screen to go dark (1, 5, 10, etc) (6) Add common wear and tear maintenance stats to each bike in Garage Chain Front Tire Rear Tire Front Cassette Rear Cassette Just a "date last changed" would be great. Predictive notifications based upon bike usage and age would be awesome. Delevopers: THANK YOU for your efforts !!!

content: This app is woefully deficient. It drains your phone while you ride. In 90 minutes of bicycling, it took the charge level on my NEW Galaxy S10 from 70% to 40%. And what information do you get while riding? Speed, distance and time. The display also shows calories burned, but this is woefully off. I know I didn't burn 1570 calories on an easy 16 mile ride on flat ground. My Polar Pacer heart rat monitor calculated 450 calories. Speaking of the heart monitor, there's no interface for one in the app. So you need yet another device. Cannondale makes fine bicycles, but they have NO documentation for their newer models with the Garmin Speed Sensor. Also none for the bike, and none for the App itself. And for what it's worth, I'm not even sure the mileage is accurate. Compared to my car's odometer, the bike says I covered 2.1 miles vs 2.0 on the car. My other bicycle, on which I have dialed in a Cat-Eye bicycle computer perfectly (and verified on measured course, agrees with my car's odometer. You DO get a Google map of the course you rode - AFTER THE FACT, and IF you know where in the app to look. This is a horribly implemented app. I gave it a try because I wanted to spare myself the cost of another bike computer and sensors, especially when my Neo X 1 comes equipped with the Garmin Speed Sensor. Alas, I'll be spending more money elsewhere. The good news, and the only reason I didn't give this a 1 star review, is that the app is free. Look elsewhere.

content: This app is excellent. There's a lot of complaints on here about it but in my experience not only does the app work well for me but even when I forget to open the app up before I cycle, the wheel sensor still records the distance and average speed and sends it to the app regardless. Obviously it won't track my journey on Google maps because I've forgotten to open the app and therefore synced the GPS, but it still clocks up the miles accurately just on wheel rotations alone. I love it.

content: I don‚Äôt understand why some have issues with this? Maybe a faulty device or old software.  I have been have used it since May 2020.  My bike came with the garmin sensor on the wheel.  Everything syncs great. The sensor wakes up when the wheel starts moving. In case you forget to open the app it will start recording for you.  If you stop for a break it will stop tracking. And when you start again it will start tracking again and later it will combine total distance that day.  We made several stops and at the end of the ride it showed the entire route and stats combined under ‚ÄúPerformance‚Äù.  The distance accuracy matches up well with my apple watch also. It shows you total miles on your bike, I wish it also showed total hours.

content: I just bought a new Cannondale and was excited to use the app.  It‚Äôs cold, windy & raining here, so I haven‚Äôt yet taken my first ride, but I‚Äôd like to explain why setup was not easy and needs to be improved.  While setting up the app, the bike sensor recognized my bike model after a few tries, but then the app required me to enter my wheel size, tire width, and tire circumference.  The Cannondale website told me my model‚Äôs wheel size, but not the other two stats, so I called the bike shop, who wasn‚Äôt sure.  I plugged in what the bike shop told me they THOUGHT my tire width & circumference were, but the app defaulted to a different number for the circumference, and then it wouldn‚Äôt save and displayed an error message.  I appreciate that a support person replied to me within a couple hours ‚Äî twice ‚Äî and that he explained to me what to do with the app.  However, the app itself needs to be improved.  I suspect that many people will not know their tire width and circumference (especially if this info is not on the website) and that the app needs to explain where to find that information.  Further, if the app is going to fill in the circumference, it should explain that also so the user doesn‚Äôt change that number.  I will submit an updated review after I take my first few rides.

content: The app collects the bike ride‚Äôs data and displays it but there could be better improvements to the app. Setting up the app went smooth. I created an account and synced the bike per the instructions. Then it loaded some previous days rides which was really nice that it stores that info even before syncing with a phone. However, after using the app for a bit, I found some flaws. There isnt a simple way to ‚Äúend‚Äù your ride. Turns out you have to click on the wheel icon and click ‚Äúend your ride and switch bikes‚Äù. Thats too extra, just needs a ‚Äúend ride‚Äù. This issue leads to the problem of having your latest ride not sync because when you leave your bike and not press the ‚Äúend ride...‚Äù button, it doesn‚Äôt sync so you can‚Äôt see the ride summary. I just learned how to end the ride and that allowed me to see the last ride. Also some music and map integration would be nice during the ride. For example if I have my phone on a phone mount, it would be nice to see a map of my progress while in a ride and also be able to change music volume for my headphones.

content:
My wife and I recently bought two Treadwell 2‚Äôs that came with the wheel sensors.   The app was really easy to install and use.  I‚Äôve really enjoyed using it and find it to be a good motivator.  Unfortunately, my wife has had issues with hers. First, the app recognized her bike as the wrong model, color and size.  Next, the app recognizes her sensor, but it refuses to record any data.   I don‚Äôt know that either of these issues are problems with the app itself.  My bike shop was able to get the data issue fixed.  We‚Äôre still working on the other issue.

I‚Äôve notice a few minor issues when using the app:  

1) About one out of every 10 rides seems to get lost and never shows up in the ride list.    

2) The bar graph that shows total miles ridden per day seems to be using UTC time rather than local time.  Evening rides always show up in the bar for the following day.

My only other comment would be that I‚Äôd like to see more integration with the health/activity apps.  For example, a ride should be added to my daily exercise tally.   This omission is the only thing keeping me from giving it 5 stars.

Otherwise, great app!
processed_text: my_wife recently bought two treadwell_2 came_with wheel_sensor really easy install use i_ve really enjoyed using find good motivator unfortunately my_wife issue first recognized as wrong model color size next recognizes sensor but refuse_to record data don_t know either these_issue problem bike_shop able_to data issue fixed still working issue i_ve notice a_few minor issue using 1 one every 10 seems lost never show_up list 2 bar graph show total_mile ridden per day seems using utc time rather_than local time evening always show_up bar following day other_comment would_be i_d like see integration_with health/activity apps for_example should_be added daily exercise tally omission only_thing keeping giving 5_star otherwise great

content:
The idea is good but execution is highly flawed. I like the handlebar mount system, and the info on the bicycle and maintenance. But the rest of it works only intermittently. 

While riding: 
1) regularly gets confused and thinks I‚Äôm starting a new ride, even when just stopped at stop sign.  Sometimes it seems to figure this out and combine rides, sometimes not.  Seems random.
2) often loses speed tracking even while keeping time tracking. 
3) mapping is on different screen than speed so have to stop and switch screens to use directions. 

While not riding:
4) the ‚Äúsynch‚Äù process is awful.  Documentation explains that garmin device has to use phone to connect to servers, and then ride tracking gets updated. It also explains that when ‚Äúlast synch date‚Äù isn‚Äôt current, how to update.  It rarely works. 
5) data is incomplete even when synced.  For example, I have a ride that shows 16.5 miles (correct) without a complete map. Ok, maybe lost connection (no way...), but why does same ride show on graph of distance by day as five miles?

I could go on.  I would recommend using the SP Connect mounting system using built-in Cannondale connection in handlebar, but don‚Äôt use this app for speed or directions while riding or to track rides over time. 

Kind of a sad effort here.

content:
My new Cannondale Quick 4 came with the Garmin wheel sensor, and I was able to fit in 3 rides, using the Cannondale Connect app, before we got 17‚Äù of snow here in Massachusetts.

My bike was recognized right away and I used a different GPS tracker at the same time. The distance and time data has been quite consistent. 

The app‚Äôs built in info related to maintenance and parts, and linked videos for training on aspects of maintenance is very beneficial for me. 

This app running on my iPhone on the SP-Connect mount of the handlebar stem, gives me a large visual display screen and is motivating me to start cycling a lot more into the future (once the snow and ice recede). It is all working as intended so far :-)

This is my first Cannondale bike and I am enjoying riding it. The app on the other is the exact opposite. Half of my rides are not recorded, the ones that are have me riding in San Francisco and I‚Äôm in Ohio.

content:
Overall the user experience of this app is not great and to provide a complete picture of your cycling behaviour it requires great improvement. 

It still gets four stars for its admirable qualities, the app can be made to be very battery friendly as you can basically turn off everything including gps and allow the Bluetooth receiver charging on the front wheel to store all data before syncing. After finishing a ride technically a sync is required and initiated inside the app. If they could make it auto sync at the end of a ride then you would never need to open the app.  

As the data is coming from the front wheel the distance and time can be fairly accurate and combined with being battery friendly makes it an asset to have built into the bike. 

This app can be pole running in the background without gps or mobile data. If you want a more detailed picture of your cycling behaviour there are better apps. 

This app is a respectable attempt at innovation and would encourage anyone with the text built in to the bike to use this battery friendly tracker.

Apple Health integration doesn‚Äôt work. It connects but provides no data to Apple health.
processed_text: overall user_experience not great provide complete picture_of your_cycling behaviour requires great improvement still four_star admirable quality made very battery_friendly as basically turn_off everything including gps allow bluetooth receiver charging front_wheel store all data before syncing finishing technically sync required initiated inside could make auto sync end_of would never need open as data coming front_wheel distance time fairly accurate combined battery_friendly make asset built pole running background without gps mobile_data if_you want more_detailed picture_of your_cycling behaviour there_are better apps respectable attempt innovation would encourage anyone text built_in use battery_friendly tracker apple_health integration doesn_t connects but provides no data apple_health

content:
I downloaded this app out of curiosity as my bike came with a sensor. 

Very impressed with the fact that the sensor seems to know what bike it is attached to, so setup was extremely easy. 
It also seems to have a memory built in, as it instantly loaded all my rides. This leads me to believe that I don‚Äôt need to use the app whilst I ride - which I‚Äôm happy with as I track my rides with my Garmin. 

I plan to use this app as a service record for my bike and it would be great to get notifications at certain intervals to ensure I get my chain changed, for example. 

I suggest, don‚Äôt expect the live recording of your rides to be flawless, get a wahoo or a garmin for that. 
BUT, this app seems to be an exciting development in the recording of rides for a maintenance point of view. 
It could even be a step towards being able to track a stolen bike??

content:
Cannondale makes great bikes, but their app leaves much to be desired.

Initial setup was a bust, as the app would not accept the serial number for my new bike. This was resolved fairly quickly and easily by contacting Cannondale support, but a frustrating start nonetheless.

Pros:
Easy, intuitive layout
Sensor can store several rides before it needs to sync

Cons:
No option to switch from miles to kilometres 
Distance data is hella inaccurate - a 6km ride registered as 8.5 miles (I wish!!!)
Does not pair with Apple Health
processed_text: make great but leaf much desired initial setup bust as would not accept serial_number new resolved fairly quickly easily contacting support but frustrating start nonetheless pro easy intuitive layout sensor store several before need sync con no option switch mile kilometre distance data hella inaccurate 6km registered as 85 mile wish was_not pair_with apple_health

content:
I think this is a tremendous app that adds real value to the bicycle and the rides. I would mirror many of the other positive comments I have seen. I do think one addition would be tremendously valuable. I would love to be able to export Ride information to Excel in order to track progress. I understand that some of the other bicycling apps might be helpful in this way, but the ability to directly send data would be extremely beneficial.

For example, I would love to look at the ratio of rider power to bike power over time. Or tracking time, distance, rider power, average speed over time. In Excel, I could look at relationships between metrics and of any metric as a trend.

content:
A few issues: 1. Map is too large making it difficult to read ride data. How about options to hide the map and increase text font size. 2. With units set to imperial, data shows imperial in the app but data on bike shows metric. 3. Option to change the clock from 24 hour display to 12 hours. Is this related to #2? 4. A toggle to turn on/off light. 5. Alarm volume is laughably low, almost inaudible. Reminds me of the extremely low volume of the tones you hear when taking a hearing test. I just wonder if a thief would even hear it. Certainly no one nearby would. Why bother? In response to your questions, yes the light is reference to item #4. I ride a Turbo Vado SL 5.0 EQ 
 UPDATE: I‚Äôve resolved items 2 & 3 on my list. Took my bike to a Specialized dealer. The mechanic showed me the settings menu on the TCU on the bike by press both the + and - buttons at same time on the power assist remote on the handlebars. Use the + - buttons to scroll up and down and the top and bottom buttons to set new settings which include Units, Date/Time, Sensors, Altitude and Regulatory. Hope this helps someone out. I did not see this information in the manual although the mechanic said it was there.
ANOTHER QUESTION: If using a heart rate monitor, will the Specialized app display live heart rate during a ride?

content:
Very useful and pleasant to use. I almost never use apps for products or services but this does provide real value. I‚Äôd love to see a way to save my tune presets for commuting, exercising, etc instead of having to remember what settings I like or relying on screenshots. I‚Äôd love to see the HRM used to keep me in a zone by dynamically adjusting motor power and ease on the fly. I‚Äôd love to see some kind of navigation integrated or bike route recognition built in. Very good early effort! Let‚Äôs hope Specialized continues to evolve and improve this into a powerful bike companion app. Finally, less likely, I‚Äôd love to see some of that diagnostic data that‚Äôs being collected.

Update: it‚Äôs a real shame that the only data exported to Apple Health is ride duration.  Would be nice to have power and cadence and other actually measurably useful data shared to track training progress. 

All in all this app provides minimum viable functionality for a premier, high end product.  Seems pretty stable though.

content:
The new app is draining my iPhone battery at an alarming rate! During a 44 mile ride today my phone went from 100% charge to completely dead in a little over two hours! I‚Äôm wondering if this is just bad battery management by the software or the fact that the GPS screen is showing 100% of the time? No other apps were running. Screen on 100% of time. content:
This is a pretty easy to use app. It‚Äôs made by to be started before your ride, twiddled with occasionally to tune your motor settings, then looked at afterwards. It‚Äôs great for that. 

Correction: I had reported I found it not very useful for your ride. It‚Äôs not great for monitoring any of the things you can look at (and there‚Äôs much inside to look at). This is because there‚Äôs no way to prevent screen lock and so every time you look at the road, it locks you out. The developer responded (below, I hope) explaining how to get to the menu to make the screen lock. I haven‚Äôt tried it yet in that mode.

I wish it had features to make it more like a trip computer like Shimano does. For example, the Shimano looked more like a trip computer and less like an app with numbers. It also showed a cool speedometer displaying how much power, max speed and such all in one cool integrated graphic.

The new app fixed a problem that I‚Äôve had since 2/23, where the Battery Level didn‚Äôt update unless I performed some voodoo with the Smart Control. The Battery Level now updates perfectly. content:
The old Mission Control app supported my Turbo S, but support was arbitrarily removed with this one, and the old app was removed from the Apple App Store despite it being common practice to leave up old Bluetooth apps for exactly this reason. All I want to do is fix the speedometer to report correctly, it seems to think I‚Äôm going way slower than I actually am after a secondhand battery replacement that I had to check was a real Specialized part. Specialized dealerships refuse to service my bike because they claim it‚Äôs too old, which is hilarious because any Mazda dealership will still take in my scrappy little hatchback made in the same year. What kind of terrible company can‚Äôt make a bicycle that lasts longer than a budget car? Avoid this company, go with name brands using Bosch motors that might actually have parts availability and support after you buy them

Edit: The developer responded asking me to talk to their support. As I stated in my review, I have talked with them already and they don‚Äôt provide support for the Turbo S anymore.

content:
I have two Comos of which one supports the Bluetooth connection to the app. That one is a 2021 Como 5.0. 
Compared to the Mission Control app this replaced. The prior app had a very useful map that clearly showed where bike-able routes were. This included little urban paths between houses even. That was a GREAT feature for me. Less important but another un-improvement is the old map had pretty accurate ‚Äúfootprints‚Äù of buildings and houses which I liked looking at. I haven‚Äôt found a way to zoom the map in or out while keeping current location on screen; that is: when I zoom I want it to stay at the level AND maintain my location in the middle. 
Improvements include great statistics right on the map display. The new app also connects quickly and (so far) reliably. Easier to use interface when starting, pausing, or ending the ride recording.

content:
I‚Äôve been riding my Specialized Turbo Vado and putting up with the old Mission Control app for two years. I‚Äôve sent helpful, constructive, and ultimately snarky feedback after seeing version after version of no new features. 

But here it is! And wow, they nailed almost everything on my wish list: Apple Health integration! More intuitive Turbo tuning! Auto Lock when powered off! Updated maps with Apple‚Äôs native base map! (Sadly, still no turn-by-turn navigation yet, but you can‚Äôt win ‚Äòem all)

Congrats and a big thanks to the app team at Specialized. Thank you for listening to your riders and making the app experience just as good as the bike itself.

content:
A few discoveries. 

On a positive note, the comfort is wonderful, and enhanced by change to my Brooks B-13. 

Power is very smooth and takes 10-15 years off the effort I had been exerting. 90% ECO when using e, with small bits of Sport and Turbo just for grins. It‚Äôs also a great training bike when ridden without assistance. 

On the ‚Äòjury is still out‚Äô.

I‚Äôm getting about 1 mile per 1.6 % of battery, which equates to 62 miles per charge. Seems like a major difference compared to the claimed 80 miles. This is on basically flat terrain, with only one 1/4 mile 10% grade at the end. Avg speed is 15-16 mph range. 

Also noted a mileage difference between Specialized app and Ride With GPS app. 1 mile per 25 miles (4%). Pretty significant aberration requiring explanation or technical adjustment.  

Last - I am a heavy perspirer, to the point where I have had to change front derailleurs due to corrosion. I say that because the drip point of my sweat is directly over the Specialized tube-inserted screen. Unless 100% sealed, this portends to be a recurring issue. 

All this to say after 1 week of riding my first e-bike, I am having a great time and looking forward to things only getting better. 

Leo Hauser

content:
Many emtb forums and Reddit groups are mourning and lamenting a key feature that set them apart. 

For some reason Specialized deleted the ability to set your heart rate and have the bike  assist just enough to keep your heart rate constant. No warning, just was gone in the current specialized app. Previous Mission Control app had it. 

It resolved many of us riders‚Äô concern that an e-bike workout won‚Äôt really be hard or motivating if we can just have the motor do the work. Setting a heart rate took care of this automatically. 

PLEASE BRING THIS BACK.

content:
End March ‚Äò24‚Ä¶. How about average HR? That‚Äôd be a nice display option of the 6 allowed on screen @ one time.

Feb ‚Äò24‚Ä¶ Well, I‚Äôm so happy that the day they announced they‚Äôd stopped supporting Mission Control they released an update to the Specialized app with ability to connect a HR monitor! Now, on 1 screen, I get 5 sec power, cadence, ride time, HR. I now can rate this 5 stars! It‚Äôs easy to use, the auto-stop/start features work better than Mission Control (faster). Old post Nov ‚Äò23‚Ä¶ Add me to the list of new Turbo riders who desperately want to see HR functionality/support added to the Specialized app. It has the potential to be a 5 star app IMO. But without communicating w my chest strap, it is of little use as I use my bike as training device‚Ä¶

content:
Why has the automatic start of ride recording been removed? This was very handy in Mission Control and it means that I won‚Äôt be using the app to record rides. I use a Karoo and rides are recorded from there except the Specialized app does not sync with Karoo but the automatic start meant that rides were still captured in the Specialized app. This won‚Äôt happen any more and I expect other users will also not be bothered to manually start a recording when it means getting your phone out of whatever pocket it has been stashed in just to start recording. Specialized will be missing out on having this useful data to inform them of usage‚Ä¶. Also some rides are missing the map overview in the list view, they show the map when you select the ride to view details but in the list view they just have a grey phone icon with a cross in it.

content:
I hoped for better. At least this upgrade didn‚Äôt obliterate my ride history like a previous update did. However, the integration with Strava is very very poor, and was difficult to re-setup. In my opinion my previous setup ought to have been carried forward seamlessly. Automatic resuming after a pause on a ride doesn‚Äôt work. Now, I have to manually restart each time I pause to ear or drink. Quiet a few of my rides failed to be recorded properly. Like they say, ‚ÄúIf it wasn‚Äôt on Strava it didn‚Äôt happen.‚Äù Plus, the cumulative kilometres actually travelled on my Levo is now different to what the App says I have ridden. 
For an App that has been around since late 2016, you would think it would have its bugs ironed out by 2024?

content:
My wife and I both ride Specialized bikes and we have stuck with the Mission Control app. However it now seems we are forced to use this new Specialized app.
Two things which make it unappealing and one is a biggie. You can not turn off the map and this massively drains your phone battery because it‚Äôs using GPS all the time. 
The 2nd is that there is no data setting to see your power setting like 25/50 or 50/75 depending on what you have the different power settings set to. This is particularly annoying for my wife who has a Como 4 and uses micro mode a lot. 
The other thing which is annoying is the very fiddly way you now have to drag to tune the different modes. It is very hard to set these settings. 
Sort these things now please.

content:
Resubmitting as my initial review and developer response were deleted after a day.

content:
FINALLY after 5 months of owning my Exe the app now works!! The last update 2 weeks ago has solved the pairing issue so many of us were having.. 

Now to review the app itself, it‚Äôs good!! The app has some great features and the ideas are all there but I can‚Äôt help thinking it‚Äôs very boring.. about as visually pleasing as an excel spreadsheet haha! 

Here‚Äôs a few suggestions for the devs reading:

- A background/theme selection of colours/fonts
- A selection of Navigation voices.. she‚Äôs so bad!
- A way of customising your own dashboard
- Use your own photo for your bike (mines resprayed so it‚Äôs weird looking at the old colour)

Anyway I‚Äôm just happy to have this working now but will keep an eye out for any future updates and change my review if anything improves!

Hope your all out shredding these beautiful machines, they really are a dream to ride!!

content: If you're thinking about buying a giant because you like the idea of sync drive tuning - know that this app will not help you do that. content: I got this app to work with my new Explore E+ 2. I love the bike so after a few weeks decided to connect the app and look into adjusting some of the power modes. I moved the bike indoors as the app only works with a good data connection. Before I could even connect to the bike the app said it needed to upgrade the firmware. Half way through this process the software locked up. I am now in a situation where the bike will not turn on and I am trying to contact my local dealer for information. My advice is to think twice about using the app as this is not really a situation that should be allowed to occur, the firmware upgrade should be designed so that data transfer is rock solid. It could now be weeks or months before I can ride my bike again and I am deeply regretting my decision to tinker with the settings.

content: Hi. The first time log in the app fill any info in settings tab then use the home tab to pair your Bike to your phone. You should update some modules so the first 3 updates should be installed with your phone close to your Bike until you update the Bluetooth module after that the last 2 updates install with no problems. If update number 2 and 3 stops just disconnect/connect Bluetooth log out the app reboot the Bike disconnecting the battery pack. You will see Service Tool when installing.

content: Update after 3 weeks: The app still works fine but I have downgraded from 5 stars to 4. Primarily for two reasons, a lack of documentation and that it is difficult to navigate back to the home page while riding to connect the device. Sometimes it will bring up a button if the bike shuts off while stopped during a ride to allow you to reconnect. But there is no way to connect the app to the bike once you have started your ride without ending the ride. Also in the settings you can connect to the camera but how do you use it? how can you record while riding? Again a lack of documentation. Nothing on their website on app page. I have had no problems with this app and my Giant Momentum LaFree ebike. It works very well with the bike. Connection with bluetooth was effortless. Like most apps, it has very little documentation so it can be trial and error understanding some of the features. I have not done any trip planning yet. I am new to ebikes and any bikes of this caliber and in my mid 60's.

content: Load the app & check for updates before you leave your home for a ride! Updates are mandatory & you will find yourself stuck in the middle of nowhere using your data plan & wasting your time downloading/installing the update. When it's done, DOUBLE CHECK any settings you may have changed with it! (dashboard appearance, imperial vs metric, & assist power levels). I drove an hour to go for a ride on a non-local trail, powered on my bike, started the app.... and got stuck with, "an update is available and needs to be installed before you can use this app". Really? Right now? So I jump through hoops on my phone to allow the app unlimited data access, then wait 20+ minutes for it to update the app AND the bike, just for it to reset ALL of my bike's settings to factory default! Using the app to track a ride would be a mistake! DO NOT RELY ON THIS FOR MAPPING YOUR RIDES! I had ridden nearly 26 miles, hit the end of the trail & had to turn around. I walked the bike maybe 20ft and the app jumped from 26.6 miles to -17.6 miles. NEGATIVE 17? For the rest of the ride it counted upwards to zero & continued counting into positive numbers, at the end of my ~53 mile ride, it said I had only ridden 5.3miles. The math doesn't even make any sense, and it's not my phone's GPS because "Map My Ride" tracked it just fine! Also, there's the continuing annoyance of having to constantly re-connect the app/phone to the bike MANUALLY every time it updates or after the bike auto-powers off because you took took too long... stretching... on the side of the trail (if you know what I mean). From now on I will only be using this app when I feel it's necessary to adjust my assist power percentages. It would be nice if they could add a feature to the app to allow the user to change a bike's "power on defaults"! ie. When I turn on my bike, the headlights come on and the assist mode is in 5, I would prefer the lights to be OFF and assist to either be 0/off or 1.
processed_text: load check update before leave home update mandatory find stuck_in middle_of nowhere using data plan wasting time downloading/installing update done double check setting may_have changed dashboard appearance imperial v metric assist power_level drove hour go nonlocal trail powered_on started got stuck update available need installed before use really right now so jump hoop my_phone allow unlimited data access wait 20 minute update reset all setting factory_default using track would_be mistake not rely_on mapping ridden nearly 26 mile hit end_of trail turn around walked maybe 20ft jumped 266 mile 176 mile negative 17 rest_of counted upwards zero continued counting positive number end_of 53 mile said ridden 53miles math was_nt even make sense not my_phone gps map tracked just_fine also there_s continuing annoyance constantly reconnect app/phone manually every_time update autopowers off took took too_long stretching side trail if_you know_what mean now using feel necessary adjust assist power percentage would_be nice_if could add feature allow user change power default ie turn_on headlight come_on assist_mode 5 would prefer light off assist either 0/off 1

content: Frustrating. You have to have location on on your phone for bluetooth to connect. Why? The bluetooth doesn't reconnect automatically if the bike turns off then on again. Pretty disappointing effort from one of the largest bike manufacturers out there. Update: I wrote the above on the 14/11/20 - it's now 08/02/21 and little has changed with the app. You go out for a ride, change the default power settings, stop to talk to someone, bike turns off, you turn the bike back on and all the power settings are set back to their default settings! Very frustrating and a problem that existed when I first started using the bike. App still painful to get to sync with bike. When bike turns off, you lose your ride and bluetooth doesn't automatically re-sync. Simply put, better to use Wahoo or Strava to record your ride and just forget the Giant app. I find it hard to believe that this is the best Giant can come up with. Just rubbish. content: The new update made the auto power settings to lag more, specially while climbing. It switches very fast to the Tour-Eco  mode very fast when the road gets bumpy. content:
I‚Äôve had a few problems with the app. My biggest is forgetting to log in while I have cell service and before I arrive at my trailhead because I usually don‚Äôt have cell service where I ride. Otherwise, it won‚Äôt open, I can‚Äôt see my battery status, speed, etc. It‚Äôs a big issue. I hate it but it‚Äôs all we‚Äôve got. I‚Äôm trying to learn to live with it‚Äîby trying to remember to log in while I have cell service and not before I lose it, which can be tricky. 

However, since the big update, every time the app resets to metric. My profile still says Imperial but my bike control shows me kilometers to empty or kilometers per hour, which doesn‚Äôt help me to monitor my speed on public roads. It‚Äôs become an issue that when we pause our bike for too long and try to reconnect (like stopping to eat), it again resets my app to metric. My profile still shows Imperial but I can‚Äôt get to that while on a ride without closing the ride. In fact, in order to get it to reconnect, I have to close the app and pray it recognizes that I want to continue my ride when I reopen it, which has become the only way to reconnect. However, when I am able to reconnect, it reverts back to metric until I save my ride, go into settings, and then when I back out of settings, everything goes back to Imperial. Until I close and reopen my app again‚Ä¶.

Prior to the big change a couple months ago, I loved everything about the app except that I need to log in while I have cell service or I can‚Äôt track my ride. The reconnect was a little funny because the ‚Äúreconnect‚Äù would stay lit the rest of the ride even though we‚Äôd reconnected. That‚Äôs no longer an issue because the reconnect icon isn‚Äôt working for me anymore.

content:
I can‚Äôt believe that this app makes me login while on the middle of the woods then says I need to connect to the internet! I‚Äôm miles away and want to know the charge in my main and booster batteries and I can‚Äôt. Who designed this app? I suspect someone who‚Äôs never ridden a Mtb. Additionally, this incompetently designed app does not support readings of the second Plus battery. While away from the internet you are left with five leds to tell you battery strength. It‚Äôs amazing that an app for $5000 to $12000 bikes has an app developed that is such a miss, and has been the center of complaints for four years. Giant obviously couldn‚Äôt care less.

And have a look at the BOT generated response that Giant has below this review. Same for everyone. There is never a real response since they do not care!

content:
Great to see a replacement for the old app, looks the part too. The first thing it wants to do is update the bike to the latest software - ok, fair enough but after 10 attempts I‚Äôm at downloading this over both WiFi and 4G it won‚Äôt get past 4% progress. 

I‚Äôve tried restarting the phone, reloading the app, restarting the bike, removing and reinstalling the bike battery and tried a different phone. 

Any suggestions giant ?
Thanks

Edit 2 weeks after initial review. 

I had to take the bike to the local giant retail store to get them to update the software. This was done efficiently during the 2nd lockdown for ¬£10. 
App now works but is of limited use. 

Power levels can be changed as before and this works well. 

Issues I have discovered so far. 

1. You need to be connected to your bike to plan a route. Bit of a pain if the bike is in the shed and you want to sit in the house to plan a ride for the following day. 
2. The directions for navigation are no longer sent to the ride control screen. This was a nice touch on the previous app so the phone can stay in your pocket. 
3. Can‚Äôt edit a route while you are currently in one. You need to finish and save that ride then start a new one. That in turn doesn‚Äôt give a true picture to your day‚Äôs ride 
4. Link to Strava upload works occasionally but sometimes doesn‚Äôt upload anything. 
4. The post ride review graphs are unreadable if the info goes above the scale.
processed_text: great see replacement old look part too first thing want update latest software ok fair enough but 10 attempt downloading over wifi 4g won_t get_past 4 progress i_ve tried restarting phone reloading restarting removing reinstalling battery tried different_phone suggestion thanks edit 2_week initial_review take local retail store update software done efficiently 2nd lockdown 10 now but limited use power_level changed as before work_well issue discovered so_far 1 need connected plan route bit pain shed want sit house plan following day 2 direction navigation no_longer sent control screen nice touch previous so phone stay pocket 3 can_t edit route currently one need finish save start new one turn doesn_t give true picture day 4 link strava upload occasionally but sometimes doesn_t upload anything 4 post review graph unreadable info go scale

content:
This app never worked well but now with latest update is completely non functional.  Just a few of the issues:
- speed, distance and time of ride no longer work; this was the only thing that did work
- map function is useless,  zooms in way too far to show a few feet scale
- if trying to plan a route will not allow entry of an address and most side streets do not show a street name
- if you are able to select a route plan you have to follow it exactly or map gets lost and will not reroute you
- parts of screen just blank out during a ride
- there is a button on the map screen that just makes the who screen go blank if you hit it.

The Giant/Momentum bikes are fantastic.  It would be better to just drop this app than release one that is this bad.

content:
I‚Äôll start by saying my new Giant reign E is awesome and I love the simple interface on the bike.

This app however is a sore point in an otherwise awesome experience.

1) No Apple Health integration, guys come on, it‚Äôs 2022.
2) Clunky interface, dark blue only.
3) Some metrics only available after saving your ride (e.g. power output).
4) Can‚Äôt delete rides (I saw this in another review and can confirm).
5) During firmware update (which wasn‚Äôt optional) the bike disconnected multiple times and the update appeared to fail (had to start again).

Hopefully you can get these fixed in a future update.

content: I don‚Äôt normally write reviews for free apps but felt compelled to leave a feedback in hopes that something is done to make the app more usable offline. When using the app where I have cellular connection to data it functions well as intended, however the areas where I take my bike does not have data coverage so I‚Äôm left with a useless app where I can‚Äôt even log in to connect to my bike let alone use the app to track my ride. There are times where I had the forethought to open the app first before I lose data coverage and the app will function but the geolocation tracking of my route is plotted against a blank map and does not refresh or update when I later have access to data.   My other gripe with the app is with the route planning feature, why in the world would a live connection to the ebike ever be needed to plan a route? If I‚Äôm planning a ride with my bike I would most likely do it ahead of time and not when I‚Äôm sitting on the bike with it turned on. If you‚Äôre looking for an app that have most of these functionality minus the ability to tweak your bike settings go with the Under Armor Map my ride app, you‚Äôll be much happier.
